title: JSO: Twin babies among 4 dead after murder-suicide
content:
JACKSONVILLE, Fla. — Neighbors say six shots rang out at Shirley Oaks neighborhood in Oceanway Friday afternoon.
Five people were shot and four of those lost their lives, authorities said.
Gawain Rushane Wilson, 28, is the suspect in the case and now dead, according to the Jacksonville Sheriff's Office.
Two killed were 5-month-old twins, Hayden Rose and Kayden Reese Hiatt.
Travis James Hiatt, 49, also lost his life.
The surviving victim, Megan Hiatt, 22, is suffering from a life-threatening gunshot wound and has had surgery, according to Mike Bruno, JSO's Director of Investigations and Homeland Security.
Wilson has a previous arrest in 2013 for a strangulation with no or minor injury. He was charged with a felony and pleaded nolo contendre. He received 2 days jail time and a year of probation.
Nearly seven months after his arrest in 2013, a woman filed an injunction for protection against Wilson for repeated dating violence. Wilson was ordered to have no contact with that woman after the court filing.
JSO received a 911 call just before four p.m. on Friday and came out to the 1300 block of South Shirley Oaks Drive to find the gruesome scene.
There was a truck packed full of boxes in the driveway and Bruno said that the shooting was a possible reaction to a domestic issue at the home.
This is a developing story. Stay with First Coast News for updates.
